channel.title: Virus
channel.description: hello, before i begin this is not about me hacking or anything like that. first off, my laptop got a virus and its a bitch. first it deletes everything on your computer, system restore, notepad, internet explorer, everything, you cant access any files. whatever your background was it changes to black, then tons of error messages come up saying files are corrupt, all of a sudden a fake system restore pops up, and starts to download more files saying its fixing it, then it wants you to edit your credit card number to pay to fix the situation, it also disables your firewall and allows all ports. its a windows xp, with mcafee antivirus. by the way, this is my school laptop, i brought it to the tech person at my school to fix it, and she gave me a spare laptop for the time being, right when i got it, i walked back to class, i then turned on the computer, everything ok, then when i logged in i get the same virus as i did before. tomarrow i am getting another spare, i think the virus is on my log in account and getting on the computer, [b]every log in has their own personal harddrive to save their files[/b]. i dont know, i really never had a virus this bad, if anyone could help me id be happy because she makes us pay to fix our laptops and if i keep getting computers viruses cause of my log in or someone else got the same virus then im gonna have to pay for it. okay so what can i do to fix the virus.

item.title: Virus
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:12, topic:420469”][quote author=kingman002 link=topic=523017.msg3804904#msg3804904 date=1320367332]
i figured out how to go on the internet and go in folders, but its all deleted
[/quote]
wat[/quote]
U HERD HIM

OT
Needs moar anti virus? Didn’t read the OP… too long… so… yeah…

Read full topic

IT people are possibly the most ostentatious, ignorant bastards in the job market.

item.title: Virus
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

Okay whatthehp, ill ask her to scan it, if all else fails ill ask her for a new log-in so much work and its all going away.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

[quote=“whattehp406, post:7, topic:420469”]Wait, did you put any flash memory in that laptop?
I think it’s the H: drive because you say it’s loaded when you log in.
Just get your tech lady to scan your personal drive and see if it’s there, else it could be a flash memory or some kind of wierd virus that goes in your own body and transfers to the computer by you touching it.[/quote]

I literally laughed out loud when I read your last sentence.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

Wait, did you put any flash memory in that laptop?
I think it’s the H: drive because you say it’s loaded when you log in.
Just get your tech lady to scan your personal drive and see if it’s there, else it could be a flash memory or some kind of wierd virus that goes in your own body and transfers to the computer by you touching it.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus
item.dc:creator: @Kakapo Kakapo
item.description:
@Kakapo wrote:

kingman002:

I don’t think that is right, and I hope not because than I’d be fucked, but I got the virus the first time at home which is where I am now, and the (h:) drive is only accessible at school. What it does is load it up on startup at school.

Same with my school The computer itself resets every day but the H drive doesnt.

If its in your H drive, wouldnt it be very easy to find?

Read full topic

item.title: Virus
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

hello, before i begin this is not about me hacking or anything like that.
first off, my laptop got a virus and its a bitch. first it deletes everything on your computer, system restore, notepad, internet explorer, everything, you cant access any files. whatever your background was it changes to black, then tons of error messages come up saying files are corrupt, all of a sudden a fake system restore pops up, and starts to download more files saying its fixing it, then it wants you to edit your credit card number to pay to fix the situation, it also disables your firewall and allows all ports. its a windows xp, with mcafee antivirus.
by the way, this is my school laptop, i brought it to the tech person at my school to fix it, and she gave me a spare laptop for the time being, right when i got it, i walked back to class, i then turned on the computer, everything ok, then when i logged in i get the same virus as i did before. tomarrow i am getting another spare, i think the virus is on my log in account and getting on the computer, every log in has their own personal harddrive to save their files. i dont know, i really never had a virus this bad, if anyone could help me id be happy because she makes us pay to fix our laptops and if i keep getting computers viruses cause of my log in or someone else got the same virus then im gonna have to pay for it.
okay so what can i do to fix the virus.

Read full topic
